hello.advice: Hello! how can I help you. Tell me your Disease. I give advice, Symtomes, treatment, Prevention.

fever.advice: You seem to have a fever. Please rest, stay hydrated, and if it persists more than 3 days, consult a doctor.

headache.advice: Headaches are often due to stress or dehydration. Rest and drink water. See a doctor if severe or persistent.

stomach pain.advice: For stomach pain, avoid heavy foods, drink warm fluids, and rest. If severe, seek medical advice.

body pain.advice: General body pain may be due to fatigue. Rest and monitor. See a doctor if it worsens.

back pain.advice: For back pain, avoid heavy lifting, rest, and use a warm compress. Consult a doctor if it persists.

sore throat.advice: Gargle with warm salt water and drink warm liquids. If very painful or lasting more than 3 days, consult a doctor.

cough.advice: Drink warm liquids and honey. See a doctor if the cough persists more than 2 weeks.

cold.advice: For a common cold, rest, drink warm fluids, and stay warm. Usually resolves in a few days.

dizziness.advice: Sit or lie down if dizzy, drink water. If frequent or with fainting, see a doctor.

typhoid.advice: Typhoid is a bacterial infection. See a doctor for proper antibiotics.

hepatitis.advice: Hepatitis affects the liver. Get tested and consult a doctor.

depression.advice: If you feel persistently sad, anxious, or hopeless, reach out to a mental health professional.

vomiting.advice: Stay hydrated and eat light meals after vomiting.

diarrhea.advice: Stay hydrated with ORS and avoid solid foods. If diarrhea is severe or bloody, seek immediate care.

chest pain.advice: Chest pain can be serious. Seek emergency medical help immediately.

hiv.advice: HIV is a virus that attacks the immune system. Please consult a healthcare professional for testing and management.

aids.advice: AIDS is the advanced stage of HIV infection. Proper medical care and treatment are essential. Please consult a doctor.

covid.advice: If you suspect COVID-19, isolate yourself, wear a mask, and get tested. Seek medical help if you have breathing difficulty.

cancer.advice: Cancer is a serious disease that requires medical diagnosis and treatment. Please see an oncologist.

diabetes.advice: Diabetes affects blood sugar levels. Eat a balanced diet, exercise, and monitor your glucose levels. Consult a doctor.

hypertension.advice: High blood pressure needs regular monitoring. Reduce salt, eat healthy, and consult your doctor.

malaria.advice: Malaria is a mosquito-borne disease. Seek medical care if you have high fever, chills, and body ache.

asthma.advice: Asthma affects breathing. Use prescribed inhalers and avoid triggers. See your doctor for a plan.

appendicitis.advice: Appendicitis can cause severe pain in the lower right abdomen. Seek emergency medical care.
prevention: No known prevention, seek early medical care

pneumonia.advice: Pneumonia is a lung infection. Symptoms include fever, cough, and difficulty breathing. See a doctor immediately.

kidney stones.advice: Kidney stones can cause severe back or side pain and blood in urine. Drink water and consult a doctor.

menstrual cramps.advice: Menstrual cramps are common. A heating pad and pain relief medication may help.

pregnancy.advice: If you suspect you’re pregnant, take a test and consult a healthcare provider for prenatal care.

snake bite.advice: Stay calm, keep the affected area still, and seek emergency medical help immediately.

dog bite.advice: Clean the wound and see a doctor for rabies vaccination if needed.

heat rash.advice: Stay cool, wear loose clothing, and keep the skin dry. Usually resolves on its own.

sunburn.advice: Cool the skin, moisturize, and stay out of the sun. See a doctor if severe.

panic attack.advice: Try deep breathing and staying calm. If frequent, seek help from a mental health professional.

high cholesterol.advice: Maintain a healthy diet, exercise, and consult a doctor for management.

low blood sugar.advice: Eat or drink something sugary immediately. Monitor levels and see a doctor if needed.

eczema.advice: Eczema causes itchy, inflamed skin. Moisturize and avoid triggers. See a dermatologist.

psoriasis.advice: Psoriasis causes scaly skin patches. Consult a dermatologist for treatment.

migraine.advice: Migraines are intense headaches. Rest in a dark room and take prescribed medication.

jaundice.advice: Yellow skin and eyes could indicate liver issues. See a doctor promptly.

flu.advice: Rest, drink fluids, and monitor your symptoms. Seek care if it worsens.

earache.advice: Ear pain may indicate infection. Avoid inserting objects and see a doctor.

eye infection.advice: Wash hands and avoid touching the eyes. See an eye doctor for treatment.

insomnia.advice: Establish a sleep routine and avoid screens before bed. See a doctor if persistent.

obesity.advice: Maintain a balanced diet and exercise. Seek advice from a healthcare provider.

thyroid disorder.advice: Thyroid issues can cause weight, mood, or energy changes. See a doctor for tests.

bronchitis.advice: Bronchitis causes cough and chest discomfort. Rest and see a doctor if severe.

tonsillitis.advice: Sore throat with swollen tonsils. Gargle with salt water and consult a doctor.

ulcer.advice: Stomach ulcers cause pain and indigestion. Avoid spicy food and see a doctor.

urinary infection.advice: Burning or frequent urination may indicate UTI. Drink water and see a doctor.

food poisoning.advice: Nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea after eating. Stay hydrated and see a doctor if severe.

burn.advice: Cool the burn under water. Do not apply ice directly. Seek care if severe.

fainting.advice: Lie down, elevate legs, and rest. See a doctor if it happens often.

dehydration.advice: Drink plenty of water and rest. Severe cases need medical care.

stroke.advice: Signs include face drooping, arm weakness, and slurred speech. Call emergency services.

seizure.advice: Protect from injury and don’t put anything in the mouth. Seek emergency help.

shock.advice: Lay the person down, keep warm, and call for emergency care.

allergy.advice: Allergies can cause rash, itching, sneezing. Avoid allergens and consult a doctor if severe.

anemia.advice: Anemia is low hemoglobin. Eat iron-rich foods and see a doctor for proper tests.

arthritis.advice: Arthritis causes joint pain and stiffness. Exercise gently and consult a doctor for medications.

default.advice: Sorry, I didn’t understand. Please consult a medical professional.
